content.description:
The first half of this route goes up a right leaning ramp. There's a crack on the left that takes good gear (0.75s). The ramp is awkward, but good sideways foot-jams can be used. The second half of the route goes straight up various cracks and ledges. The crux is probably a couple laybacks with smearing feet to gain solid rests. Watch for some kitty-litter near the last ledge.

Look for the right leaning ramp that leads to a vertical set of cracks.
Gear to 2", use trees for top anchor.

Be mindful when pulling your rope, they tend to slide down the crack and get caught* 
Start either on the left corner, or right slab to gain a good ledge.
You can put in a finger sized piece just below the second bolt.
Pull onto the wide lay back corner, clip a bolt and jam the corner to the top.
The crack gets wide at the top, bring a #5 then use the thin-hand crack on the left to protect this section.

Past all the steep cracks of the lower west wall, walk up the canyon till you find slabby terrain. 
single rack to 5 inches, 2 bolts and anchor.

Scamper up a ledge. Next do some jamming in this big crack. You have to shove your right arm way in to get one good hand jam, while the left side of your body sort of hugs the wall and grabs as some flared crack. Then you shimmy up as best you can to a ledge, which you awkwardly mantle. From here it's a bunch of jamming (hands and fists) with some crimps every now and then when you need 'em. Eventually you can layback - sort of - and get into the proper chimney section. Chimney up, then turn around, then it's squeeze chimney. After that you get on the face and somehow get to the top. Skinnier short people may find this last section easier. Gear to 5". Takes medium gear in the cracks deep inside. Protects decently. Doubles from 1" to 4" for sure.
Bolts at the very top (left and over lip).
To set a top rope, I would set up an anchor from the anchor bolts (perpendicular) and have the rope go through the hole in the roof.

Put Up by Mate in 2019.  I think it is still waiting for a repeat...

From Mate: "The start is a poorly protected Boulder (5.11, PG13), small offset cams may be useful here. As you get higher the gear gets better and so does the climbing! Used a mix of gear from .3 - 2" 



Just left of  Sky Traveler.  

gear from .3 - 2.  Bolted Anchor

Climbs rounded features and cracks/seams

First route on the west wall of the canyon
8 bolts

This is an obvious beautiful hand crack that goes all the way from the bottom to the top.

Gear to 3", anchors at top.
Sunny all day. This area is home to some impressive looking crack climbs.
